item.title: Minecraft Players Build Toothless From How to Train Your Dragon
item.description:
Fans of the How To Train Your Dragon series of films have created an impressive recreation of Toothless, the lead dragon, within Minecraft . Numerous fans of the fantasy film franchise have shared their praise for the Minecraft rendition of the iconic Night Fury with the Minecraft designer.

Minecraft players frequently make builds of their favorite characters and landmarks within the sandbox game. How to Train Your Dragon has been a popular film franchise for quite some time now, but with the live-action adaptation of How to Train Your Dragon having just released in theaters, it's not surprising to see it highlighted in a recent piece like this one.

On Reddit, prolific Minecraft creator Kaizens87 x Niquoles shared their latest work, this time bringing Toothless, the Night Fury, to life. The blocky rendition of Toothless is spot-on to how the dragon appears in both the original How to Train Your Dragon films and the live-action remake. Toothless is perched, with its tail wrapped around the base of its body, while it looks on ahead at something. The overall build of the dragon is an excellent likeness, with the artists even including the tail contraption that Hiccup built for Toothless, as well as Toothless' iconic "blep" expression, with its tongue sticking out.

Minecraft Fans Are Excited About Toothless

As mentioned, many users have complimented Kaizens87 on the creation, acknowledging the detail and accuracy in particular. Several asked about how it was made, wondering if the user had used third-party tools to build it. Kaizens87 claims it was made without the use of external programs, and was built in Minecraft 's creative mode. However, the actual images shared are taken from outside Minecraft , as the user exported their completed work into the Blender animation and modeling software to take these shots. That's also how the author was able to make Toothless' eyes glow.

For other fans of Minecraft and How to Train Your Dragon , players can download the model from the user directly via the creator's Patreon. While it's on Patreon, users don't have to spend money to get it, as they can access it with a free account. However, those who prefer to stick with official Minecraft releases are also in luck, as the game has seen multiple DLC for How to Train Your Dragon . This includes Minecraft How to Train Your Dragon DLC for the new 2025 movie, as well as an older 2021 Minecraft DLC release based upon the Dragons animated TV series that spun off of the first film.

6 Images
6 Images

item.title: Once Human Adds Big Feature, Teases Future Updates
item.description:
Once Human has just released a big update, giving players the ability to make Custom Servers with their own game rules. Also, Once Human announced the Global Annual Version 2.0 Showcase, promising a look at upcoming content and features.

Once Human came out in July 2024 and quickly became popular, reaching over 230,000 concurrent players on Steam. The game stood out for its mix of fun gameplay, horror-inspired setting, and easy-to-use base-building system. Since its launch, the game has stayed in the headlines with regular updates that keep the game fresh and engaging. In April, for example, Once Human added dog companions, a highly requested feature that thrilled players eager for animal allies.

Recently, the game launched its Custom Servers, adding to the growing list of features in Once Human , while also unveiling plans for the upcoming Global Annual Version 2.0 Showcase set for July 2, 2025. These official, private servers let players change the game to fit what they want - from calm building experiences to tough survival challenges. According to the developer, server owners can customize a wide range of parameters, including weather patterns, day-night cycles, character attributes, experience gain, resource respawn rates, and building difficulty. Players can also pick from existing Once Human PvE or PvP modes, or create their own special game setups. In the future, mod support and exclusive custom scenarios are planned, offering even more ways to personalize gameplay.

Once Human Adds Custom Server Feature

Custom Servers run on a secure, dedicated system separate from official servers, making sure player data stays safe and stable over time. Each server comes with a Dedicated Server Management Panel, giving creators GM privileges, full control over server management, and the ability to handle player permissions. Access works through unique invitation codes, letting owners invite friends, while unlocked servers allow anyone to “jump right in.” Subscriptions for the free-to-play survival adventure shooter Once Human 's Custom Servers can be purchased through the in-game store, with pricing based on server size and on how long players want the server to run.

The upcoming Showcase will reveal Once Human ’s updated roadmap, including the much-anticipated reveal of a new Scenario and new details about the recently announced PvP spin-off, Once Human: Raidzone , which is currently taking pre-registrations ahead of its July release. Meanwhile, pre-registration for the game's Annual Version 2.0 is now open, with exclusive Once Human rewards like a Graffiti T-Shirt cosmetic, an Annual Version 2.0 Avatar, Butterfly’s Emissary Crates, and Starchrom for those who sign up early.

item.title: Pokemon TCG Pocket: Best Nihilego Deck
item.description:
The ever-evolving expansions of Pokemon Trading Card Game Pocket keep players on their toes, with each new set shaking up competitive strategies and creating new synergies or Ace Pokemon within the meta. Whether you're climbing the PvP ladder or just looking for a strong composition for grinding out in-game challenges or event rewards, ensuring you have a solid deck build and strategy can make all the difference.

An intriguing card introduced in recent expansions is Nihilego, which has unique capabilities of boosting the effects of Poison. This means Nihilego thrives as a support Pokemon in lineups that focus on inflicting pesky status effects, such as Poisons, on the enemy's Active Pokemon. For those interested in building a deck that maximizes this Ultra Beast’s potential, the following guide breaks down one of the most effective Nihilego decks currently performing in the Pokemon TCG Pocke t meta.

Best Nihilego Deck in Pokemon TCG Pocket, Explained

Nihilego is an interesting card to build around when it comes to deck creation. It has lower HP at the 70 mark, but it is considered a basic Pokemon, so it can be used as early as turn 1 to help set up poisons and disrupt the enemy from the get-go. The More Poison Ability causes the enemy's Active Pokemon to take +10 damage from Poison, and the New Wave attack can deal 30 damage and inflict the Poison status each turn, at the simple cost of 2 Energy being equipped.

Guzzlord ex works perfectly alongside Nihilego as a more aggressive offensive card and primary Ace Pokemon. It is a basic Pokemon, which comes in very handy for ex cards to enable them to play as soon as possible. Guzzlord comes paired with 170 hp, and the Grindcore move deals 30 damage plus can disarm Energies from the opponent's Active Pokemon based on successful coin flips, therefore disrupting the enemy even further. Lastly, Guzzlord also has the Tyrannical Hole move for 4 Energies equipped, dishing out a whopping 120 damage per turn, which is enough to knock out even some ex cards in a single hit.

Celesteela utilizes the secondary support Pokemon role and single-handedly enables your strategy and flow between Nihilego and Guzzlord, so you will want to get this one on the bench ASAP. Specifically, value comes in the Ultra Thrusters ability, which enables you to switch out one of your Active Ultra Beasts with a Benched one once per turn. Essentially, you can inflict your poisons with Nihilego, and then swap into Guzzlord for the killing blow. In a pinch, swapping into Celesteela can also work for an early-mid game knockout if Guzzlord is not yet ready, as it does have a 4 Energy cost attack that deals 100 damage on a successful coin flip, though 0 at a fail, so it's a lucky shot.

The remainder of the deck is filled with Supporter/Item cards to help enable this strategy. Poison Barb pairs well with the poison approach of this deck, especially via Nihilego's ability to bump up that damage. By placing it on Celesteela or Guzzlord, you can inflict poisons when they take damage, which helps keep the poison active while Nihilego is switched out. Lusamine can help in swiftly setting up Guzzlord ex by attaching extra Energies from your Discard Pile, preparing for that deadly 120-damage attack as early as possible. Mars and Cyrus are used to further disrupt your opponent, and Pokemon Center Lady helps promote the uptime of your key Pokemon through a small heal.

Nihilego Deck Build

item.title: 9 Best Animal Companions In Horror Games
item.description:
There is no doubt that well-made horror games can be incredibly scary. Roaming around eerily dark, quiet, seemingly abandoned buildings where sinister serial killers and malevolent entities are lurking is the core source of fear in many of these experiences, and having to face the dangers alone only makes it more isolating.

Many horror games feature animals as enemies - like the zombie dogs in Resident Evil - or as their own characters in the narrative - like Alice from The Last of Us Part 2 - but some offer players a little comfort in the shape of an animal friend that sticks by their side throughout. From protective dogs to mischievous cats, these are some of the best animal companions in horror games.

This list focuses on animal companions that accompany and/or help the player throughout the game, rather than simply being present in some scenes.

9 Anubis (Claire)

Faithful Canine Or Ancient God In Disguise?

3 Images
3 Images
Claire
Survival Horror
Systems
Released
July 7, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Hailstorm Games
Platform(s)
PC, PS Vita, PlayStation 4, Xbox One
Powered by

Claire is a relatively less talked-about retro-style 2D horror game that follows Claire as she searches for her mother in a hospital. It's not long before her surroundings begin to decay, and monsters emerge to confront Claire about her past. The game is often compared to Silent Hill and Lone Survivor , though it has a lot of its own merits in terms of story and atmosphere.

Throughout the game, Claire is accompanied by her dog, Anubis , who will growl or bark when there are monsters nearby. His name is also a reference to the ancient Egyptian god of the dead, perhaps hinting to morbid themes within the narrative.

8 Wolfie (Until Dawn)

Every Choice Matters

Until Dawn
8 /10
12
8.9 /10
Released
August 25, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Supermassive Games
Publisher(s)
Sony
Platform(s)
PS4
Powered by

This entry contains minor spoilers for the outcomes of decisions surrounding Wolfie! Until Dawn was Supermassive Games's first title to use the "butterfly effect" structure, following multiple protagonists with branching storylines . It was well-received, earning both a remake in 2024 and a film the year after, and setting the standard for their future games of the same ilk.

Set on Mount Washington, deemed sacred by the native Cree tribe, the protagonists soon find themselves hunted by threats both human and monstrous. If they play their cards right, players can befriend Wolfie , a wolf who will return to guide and help later in the game.

7 Bella (Baisu)

K-9 Turned Ghost Hunter

  • Release Date: 30 May, 2024
  • Developer: Tripleducks studios
  • Platforms: Windows

Baisu is a bodycam horror game with players taking on the role of Clay Kriest, a police detective who has been summoned to the Smith house. Finding the property empty, players must investigate and unravel the mystery behind the family's fate, uncovering a much darker presence in the process.

It is not just Kriest's life in players' hands, though, as his dog Bella accompanies him on the investigation. Players can use their voice to give Bella commands like "stay", "follow", and "search", but must be careful with their in-game choices, as there are multiple endings, and not all of them are happy.

6 Mr. Midnight (Fran Bow)

An Adorable Talking Cat That Is Worth Facing Peril For

5 Images
5 Images
Fran Bow
Adventure
Indie Games
Puzzle
Systems
Released
August 17, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Killmonday Games AB
Platform(s)
Android, Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 4, iOS, macOS, Microsoft Windows, Xbox One
Powered by

2D horror games, while simplistic in design and mechanics, can prove some of the most unsettling. Fran Bow is one such example, following the titular young girl as she flees Oswald Asylum to rescue her helpful and comforting cat, Mr. Midnight , facing benevolent and sinister monsters along the way.

Fran Bow is not overtly scary, but the familiar environments are twisted into something strange and uncanny, leaving players uneasy. The game also engages in an uncomfortable exploration of trauma and mental health struggles, making Mr. Midnight's presence all the more welcome.

5 Brown (Rule Of Rose)

The Unquestionable Loyalty Of A Childhood Pet

Rule Of Rose
7.0 /10
Released
January 19, 2006

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Punchline
Publisher(s)
Sony Computer Entertainment, Atlus, 505 Games
Platform(s)
PlayStation 2
Powered by

Rule of Rose is a survival horror inspired by the fairy tales of the Brothers Grimm. Players take on the role of a teenager, Jennifer, who finds herself at an orphanage after following a young boy off of the bus. What ensues is a psychological nightmare that confronts Jennifer with her traumatic past.

Fortunately, she has her labrador retriever, Brown , by her side throughout the game. Brown can track and locate items, as well as distract enemies during combat. Despite some janky gameplay elements, Rule of Rose' s atmosphere and story prevail for an overall poignant experience.

4 Cheshire Cat (Alice: Madness Returns)

The Cryptic Cat Of Carroll's Classic Novel

Alice: Madness Returns
6 /10
8.0 /10
Released
June 14, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Spicy Horse
Publisher(s)
Electronic Arts
Platform(s)
PC, PS3, Xbox 360
Powered by

On the surface, Alice: Madness Returns is an action-packed hack-and-slash game, but that's not all there is to it. Beneath the whimsical Wonderland settings is a dark psychological horror narrative about abuse and exploitation, which is not-so-subtly implied through the symbolism in the world.

Guiding Alice through Wonderland is the iconic Cheshire Cat , though he appears much less approachable than in the movie adaptations. But despite having an attitude problem and a menacing grin, this scraggy feline has plenty of insight and advice (which is admittedly often enigmatic at best).

3 Tonia (In Sound Mind)

The Embodiment Of Pet Therapy

In Sound Mind
Action
Horror
Systems
Released
September 28, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
We Create Stuff
Publisher(s)
Maximum Entertainment
Platform(s)
PC, Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X
Powered by

In Sound Mind is a psychological horror with an interesting premise. The game follows amnesiac therapist Desmond Wales as he delves into the troubled minds of his patients, gradually uncovering the dire events that connect their fates. The story is told via a visually striking combination of puzzles, platforming, and gunplay.

Tonia is Desmond's cat that politely resides on his desk and appears to aid and encourage him throughout the game. She talks and sings but, more importantly, offers emotional relief from the horrors of the psyche; pet therapy in its truest form.

2 Bullet (Blair Witch Project)

A Smart & Protective Partner In Crime-Busting

Blair Witch
7 /10
9.0 /10
Released
August 30, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Bloober Team
Publisher(s)
Lionsgate Games
Franchise
Blair Witch
Platform(s)
PS4, Xbox One, Switch, PC, Amazon Luna
Powered by

The Blair Witch Project movie paved the way for found footage cinema and, of course, the "lost in a dark scary forest" trope that is becoming ever more popular in horror games. Blair Witch takes place in the same universe as the film, following ex-cop Ellis as he searches for a missing boy in Black Hills Forest.

As the sun sets and the player delves deeper into the woods, the more sinister things become as shadows of the past begin to emerge. Fortunately, they have the company of German shepherd Bullet , who can track scents, detect enemies, and keep Ellis's sanity stable. Perhaps most importantly, players can pet Bullet.

1 Hewie (Haunting Ground)

The Goodest Survival Horror Companion

Haunting Ground
9.0 /10
Released
May 10, 2005

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Capcom
Platform(s)
PS2, PS3
Powered by

The Resident Evil franchise is most often hailed as Capcom's legacy in the survival horror genre, but fans shouldn't forget about another of the developer's classic titles, The Haunting Ground . The protagonist, Fiona, awakens in the dungeon of a castle after a car crash and must find a way to escape the hostile inhabitants.

Navigating the castle, players will come across a white Alsatian, Hewie , who will follow Fiona for the rest of the game. Hewie is an invaluable asset; not only can players give him basic commands, they can also ask him to search for items, scout out suspicious areas to expose traps, and attack enemies. Players must make sure, though, to maintain the pooch's happiness via praise and treats to ensure his obedience. Fortunately, caring for this canine is not at all a chore.

item.title: 10 Best RPGs With 100+ Hours of Content, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • RPGs with 100+ hours of content offer rich, engaging experiences beyond sheer volume.
  • Titles like Dragon Age: Inquisition, Persona 5 Royal, and Baldur's Gate 3 introduce new gameplay elements.
  • Games like The Witcher 3, Elden Ring, and Skyrim maintain player interest with expansive worlds and content.

One of the most intriguing aspects of RPGs is the way games can vary in so many ways, with multiple possible settings and lengths to suit every preference. While some titles in the genre deliver more grounded adventures, others are massive in both content and the time needed to experience it all, offering complex worlds and mechanics that hold a player’s attention for weeks.

Thus, the best RPGs with more than 100 hours of content are titles that value not only sheer volume but also execution, always giving players something fresh to keep gameplay engaging. Even after a long time with them, it is still possible to find something fun to do, keeping the experience rich.

10 Dragon Age: Inquisition

An Epic Journey That Goes Beyond The Main Story

Dragon Age: Inquisition
9 /10
12
8.3 /10
Released
November 18, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Intense Violence, Nudity, Sexual Content, Strong Language
Powered by

The series has always carried an epic and cinematic tone, but Dragon Age: Inquisition expands the experience, offering a vast universe of semi-open regions to explore, each filled with side quests and secrets to uncover. Playing as the Inquisitor, players must not only fight demonic threats spilling from a mysterious rift in the sky but also manage resources and allies strategically through the War Table.

Beyond the original content, three main DLCs add narrative depth and new areas to explore, significantly pushing total playtime well past 100 hours of adventure. The Trespasser expansion stands out as a crucial epilogue to the core story, elegantly tying up loose ends and paving the way for future entries, ensuring a lasting, rewarding experience for committed players and dedicated fantasy fans.

9 Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2

Immersion And Historical Realism In A Colossal RPG

12 Images
12 Images
Kingdom Come: Deliverance II
10 /10
44
9.0 /10
Released
February 4, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Mature 17+ // Use of Alcohol, Blood and Gore, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Intense Violence, Partial Nudity
Powered by

Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 takes the historical realism that defined the first game even further, once again placing players in Henry’s boots amid the chaos of a fifteenth-century Bohemian civil war. Warhorse Studios’ RPG stands out for the authenticity of its detailed world, from vast forests and imposing castles to medieval villages, presenting meticulous historical accuracy and deeply immersive mechanics that sustain long-term engagement.

The game’s epic narrative, packed with branching choices and real consequences, greatly extends longevity, encouraging multiple playthroughs to explore every path and discover unique NPC interactions. Adding to this already extensive experience, Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 also features planned post-launch DLC, guaranteeing players hundreds of additional hours to lose themselves in its carefully crafted medieval world and rich historical setting.

8 Pathfinder: Wrath Of The Righteous

RPG Is Massive Even When Playing Only The Main Campaign

Pathfinder: Wrath of the Righteous
8 /10
9.0 /10
Released
September 2, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood and Gore, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

True to its tabletop roots, Pathfinder: Wrath of The Righteous offers truly remarkable complexity, even among CRPGs already known for deep mechanics and sprawling narratives. Even when players focus solely on the main campaign missions, the adventure can last nearly 100 hours to complete, thanks to demanding battles and pivotal choices that shape the crusade from start to climactic finish.

Players who decide to delve even deeper into everything the game offers, ranging from companion side stories and their parallel narratives to challenge-rich optional quests, will see total playtime balloon even further for any story-driven enthusiast and tactician. Although undeniably complex, this sustained commitment is handsomely rewarded with one of the finest, most satisfying experiences available in the entire RPG genre today.

7 Xenoblade Chronicles X Definitive Edition

Huge World Gives This JRPG Over 100 Hours Of Playtime

6 Images
6 Images

Your comment has not been saved

Follow
Followed
Xenoblade Chronicles X: Definitive Edition
RPG
Action
Systems
8.0 /10
Released
March 20, 2025
ESRB
Teen // Animated Blood, Language, Suggestive Themes, Use of Alcohol, Violence
Developer(s)
Monolith Soft
Publisher(s)
Nintendo

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

While JRPGs are often remembered for enormous stories, a few goes even further, as Xenoblade Chronicles X Definitive Edition demonstrates for ambitious adventures. With an approach that differs somewhat from other games in the franchise, the title embraces a massive open world, one that even influenced the development of The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild , to give players endless activities.

The game improves further when players gain access to various mechs that aid exploration, letting them reach new areas of the map and tackle stronger foes. Coupled with combat that becomes enjoyable once the system clicks, the title stands among the best not only in the JRPG field but also across open-world games and sweeping, fully explorable landscapes for players.

6 Fallout 4

The Commonwealth Is Packed With Activities

Fallout 4
9 /10
47
8.8 /10
Released
November 10, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M FOR MATURE: BLOOD AND GORE, INTENSE VIOLENCE, STRONG LANGUAGE, USE OF DRUGS
Powered by

Although the main campaign of Fallout 4 is relatively short compared with other genre entries, taking a little more than 30 hours to see everything it offers, the game remains one of the most massive projects ever developed by Bethesda. The RPG’s Commonwealth is a huge open-world map filled with locations for players to discover during moment-to-moment gameplay, random encounters, and lengthy settlement quests that emerge during every session.

For players who like to get lost on the map and explore every point of interest before advancing the central story, Fallout 4 can easily deliver well over 100 hours of content across multiple playstyles. Beyond that, even though not every fan uses the feature, building settlements, crafting equipment, and managing supply routes can stretch the overall experience even further and keep the wasteland engaging.

5 Persona 5 Royal

Expanded Content Makes The Game Even Larger

Persona 5 Royal
10 /10
15
9.5 /10
Released
March 31, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Drug Reference, Partial Nudity, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

Even the base version of Persona 5 already feels enormous, blending dungeon exploration with social-simulation and time-management elements that demand attention across many in-game days, so the main campaign alone approaches 100 hours of playtime without rushing. However, the third-semester content added in Persona 5 Royal pushes the total length significantly higher, adding new story beats, a palace, fresh confidants, and challenging endgame encounters.

The gameplay loop in Persona 5 Royal never grows stale because the JRPG revolves around managing the characters’ calendar, dividing time between dungeon runs and strengthening bonds with other NPCs while chasing personal goals. Paired with a stylish, jazz-infused soundtrack that accompanies players through every scene, the experience stays engaging at each moment and often leaves fans wanting even more days with the Phantom Thieves.

4 The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt

Quests And Characters Make This RPG Interesting

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt
9 /10
50
9.4 /10
Released
May 19, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Use of Alcohol, Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content
Powered by

After two earlier installments with modest scope, CD Projekt Red turned The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt into one of its most ambitious creations and produced a genuine masterwork of the genre that set new industry standards. The game combines a carefully detailed semi-open world with a narrative packed with weighty decisions and a supporting cast developed in depth throughout Geralt’s far-reaching journey across multiple kingdoms.

Those elements alone form the backbone of the game’s content, making each quest and point of interest one of the best experiences found in any RPG thanks to richly written dialogue and thematic coherence. Luckily, CD Projekt Red went even further, and with the two major DLC expansions, Hearts of Stone and Blood and Wine , that add still more land to explore and stories to tell, the title easily surpasses 100 hours of play.

3 The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim

So Much Content Player Can Ignore The Main Quest

Skyrim
9.3 /10
Released
November 11, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Use of Alcohol, Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes
Powered by

Among its peers, Skyrim is perhaps the game that best defines total freedom, because after the brief introduction in Helgen, virtually no restrictions remain on the player’s path. As a result, one can ignore the entire main plot and instead roam dungeons, accept side quests, and sample the other content Bethesda created, turning the title into one of the defining phenomena of the 2010s for open-world design.

Although a strong mod community has extended the game’s longevity even further with new lands and mechanics, Skyrim still offers considerably more than 100 hours of content without any external additions thanks to guild questlines and radiant activities. Even a full decade after release, the RPG continues to provide a singular sandbox sensation inside the genre, despite numerous larger titles having launched in the intervening years.

2 Elden Ring

It Can Take Hundreds Of Hours To Experience Everything

6 Images
6 Images
Elden Ring
10 /10
64
9.1 /10
Released
February 25, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by

Many soulslikes developed by FromSoftware are massive in scope, but the amount to do in Elden Ring exists on another level, merging the studio’s signature combat formula with a sprawling open world that constantly nudges players off the critical path to explore. That curiosity is rewarded in multiple ways, from secret bosses and underground cities to invaluable upgrade resources scattered across the Lands Between’s varied regions.

Combat is another highlight of this open-world RPG, and while veterans may find it slightly easier thanks to familiar mechanics and expanded build diversity, the learning curve remains steep for newcomers who must adapt. Considering those challenges, the enormous map, thorough legacy dungeons, and all the content introduced in its substantial DLC, the game can effortlessly exceed 100 hours of engrossing, death-defying play.

1 Baldur's Gate 3

There Is Always Something New To Discover In This RPG

Baldur's Gate 3
9 /10
132
9.7 /10
Released
August 3, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Partial Nudity, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

The isometric adventure developed by Larian Studios is gigantic, and in a single run it is impossible to see everything on offer because, depending on player choices, many battles can be avoided or certain characters never encountered at all. Consequently, Baldur’s Gate 3 always holds something new to discover, reactively adapts to decisions, and actively encourages multiple playthroughs to reveal hidden narrative branches.

Even so, within one campaign, Baldur’s Gate 3 easily clears the 100-hour mark for those interested in combing every corner of the map and interacting with as many characters as possible, including optional recruitable allies. Thanks to the world’s reactivity and the freedom provided, it is simple to invest hundreds of hours in this RPG and still uncover fresh story moments, combat scenarios, or secret treasures.
